relevant_findings.finding_desc: 24-hour urine analysis showed normal metanephrine and normetanephrine concentrations.
relevant_findings.examination_desc: MRI of the head and neck was normal. CT of the abdomen revealed an incidental adrenal tumor with a maximum diameter of 14 cm, and MRI of the neck showed an 8-mm HNPGL.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The thoracic lesions remained stable for 3 years and later progressed to acute radicular syndrome due to lytic vertebral bone metastasis.

relevant_findings.finding_desc: Follow-up MRI scans showed slight growth of both HNPGLs.
relevant_findings.examination_desc: Plasma catecholamine metabolite levels had remained normal.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Two years after surgery, the patient developed fatigue and episodes of fever. Additional imaging showed multiple lesions in the liver and lungs, suggestive of metastatic disease.
